ground_truth: The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men, and the soldiers open fire on them, causing women to cry and hide their eyes. Soldiers break into homes and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly. A soldier shoots a man dead, and then the commander addresses the village, leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. In Rambo's fort, sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel, his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He stops grinding, drops the blade, and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench. He removes a nut from the rod, discards the fan, and replaces it with his creation, a new fan. He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod, reaches onto a bench, picks up a spanner, and tightens the nut. He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down, then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air. His boat is moored below at the water's edge, and he looks down at it, where a solitary figure sits on the boat. Rambo wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat, where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy. She stands, soaking wet, and he stares blankly at her. Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him, climbing onto the harbor. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway, pauses, and brushes rain from her head. Rambo steps onto the harbor; she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look, brushing rain from her hair once more. Rambo stares at her, his face betraying no emotion. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor, wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans, and climbs the wooden walkway. Rambo rubs his chin, runs a hand through his hair, and walks along the harbor. In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river, Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the tiller. Michael glances at Rambo, who affords him the merest flicker in return, as Rambo stoically leans on the tiller with both hands. Sarah approaches him, smiles, and turns away. At dusk, the boat motors around a headland, a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a cone-shaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat, which has headlamps mounted on its canopy. Michael and his volunteers doze in the boat, with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest, while Rambo's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The villagers have their hands behind their heads as armed men are found by them, and fire is opened on the villagers by the soldiers, causing women to cry and hide their eyes. Homes are broken into by soldiers, and youths are dragged out while the officer coolly watches. A man is shot dead by a soldier, and then the village is addressed by the commander, leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. Sparks fly in Rambo's fort as round blades are ground on a spinning wheel by him, his veins standing out on his muscular arms. Grinding is stopped by him, the blade is dropped, and his hair is run through by his hand. Nearby, a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench. A nut is removed from the rod by him, the fan is discarded, and his creation, a new fan, is replaced. A nut is added to the thread at the rod's end by him, a spanner is picked up from a bench, and the nut is tightened. The assembly is deftly lifted off the bench by him and put down, then the workshop is left by him as he walks out into the rainy night air. Below at the water's edge, his boat is moored, and down at it, he looks, where a solitary figure sits on the boat. Rain is wiped away from his face by Rambo, and he walks down a wooden walkway to the boat, where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy. She stands, soaking wet, and a blank stare is given by him at her. Disappointment is shown by Sarah as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him, climbing onto the harbor. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway, pauses, and brushes rain from her head. The harbor is stepped onto by Rambo; she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look, brushing rain from her hair once more. A stare is given by Rambo at her, his face betraying no emotion. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor, wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans, and the wooden walkway is climbed by her. His chin is rubbed by Rambo, his hair is run through by his hand, and the harbor is walked along by him. In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river, Michael addresses his party while the tiller is controlled by Rambo. A glance is given by Michael at Rambo, who affords him the merest flicker in return, as the tiller is leaned on stoically by Rambo with both hands. Sarah approaches him, smiles, and turns away. At dusk, the boat motors around a headland, a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a cone-shaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat, with headlamps mounted on its canopy. Michael and his volunteers doze in the boat, with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest, while Rambo's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Villagers, hands behind their heads, find themselves facing armed men as soldiers fire, causing women to cry and shield their eyes. Soldiers invade homes, dragging out youths while the officer calmly observes. A soldier shoots a man, then the commander addresses the village, leaving terrified women to stifle their cries. In Rambo's fort, sparks fly as he grinds blades, veins bulging on his muscular arms. He halts, drops the blade, and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, he removes a rusted fan from a rod and replaces it with a new one, tightening it with a spanner. He lifts the assembly, leaves the workshop, and steps into the rain. His boat is moored at the water's edge, where a lone figure sits. Rambo wipes his face and approaches the boat; Sarah sits beneath the canopy. Soaked, she stands, and he gazes blankly at her. Disappointed, Sarah walks past him, brushes rain off her head, and heads towards the harbor walkway. She pauses, turns back, and approaches him with a pleading look, brushing rain from her hair again. Rambo stares impassively. She smiles faintly, walks back in her wet hoodie and jeans, and climbs the walkway. Rambo touches his chin, runs a hand through his hair, and follows along the harbor. In the morning, on Rambo's boat, Michael speaks to his group while Rambo steers stoically, exchanging a brief glance with Michael. Sarah smiles at Rambo before moving away. At dusk, the boat rounds a headland, headlamps casting a cone-shaped reflection in the water. Michael's volunteers doze, Sarah nestled against him, while Rambo remains alert.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The villagers, hands behind their heads, face armed men as soldiers fire, causing women to cry and hide. Soldiers invade homes, dragging youths out, while a calm officer observes. A soldier kills a man, and the commander speaks to the village, leaving terrified women speechless. In Rambo's fort, sparks fly as he grinds blades, his veins bulging. He stops, drops the blade, and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, a rusty fan sits on a bench. He removes a nut, discards the fan, and replaces it with his new creation. Tightening the nut with a spanner, he lifts the assembly and exits into the rainy night. His boat, moored below, holds a solitary figure. Rambo wipes his face and approaches the boat where Sarah sits under the canopy. Wet, she stands, disappointed, as she walks past him to the harbor. She pauses, brushes rain from her hair, and walks along the harbor. Rambo follows, emotionless. She turns, offers a faint smile, and returns along the harbor. Clad in a wet hoodie and jeans, she climbs the walkway. Rambo rubs his chin and follows. In morning light on Rambo's boat, Michael speaks to his group while Rambo steers stoically, acknowledging Michael's glance with a flicker. Sarah smiles at Rambo and turns away. At dusk, the boat rounds a headland, revealing a white glimmer on the river. Michael's volunteers nap, with Sarah against Michael, as Rambo's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The villagers stand in a line with their hands placed firmly behind their heads when they suddenly encounter armed men. The soldiers heartlessly open fire on these innocent villagers, resulting in the women screaming aloud in terror and desperately covering their eyes in fear. Soldiers forcefully invade the homes in the village, dragging the young men outside while the officer in charge watches with a detached and chilling demeanor. One of the soldiers coldly shoots a man, ending his life instantly. The commander then addresses the entire village, leaving the women to stifle their cries with their hands covering their mouths in terror. 

Meanwhile, in the fortified area where Rambo is, sparks fly vividly in the dim light as he meticulously grinds round blades on a rapidly spinning wheel, the veins on his well-defined, muscular arms standing out prominently. After some time, he ceases his grinding work, lets the blade drop, and absentmindedly runs a hand through his hair. Resting nearby is an old, rusted metal fan, precariously balanced on a rod on a bench. With a determined glance, he removes a nut from the rod, discards the aged fan, and skillfully replaces it with his newly crafted creation, a modern fan. He carefully threads a nut onto the rod's end, reaching over to the bench to grab a spanner, and with deft precision, he tightens the nut securely. He expertly lifts the entire assembly off the bench and places it down with care, then exits the workshop and steps out into the cool, rainy night air.

Below, by the water's edge, moored at the dock, is his boat. Rambo gazes down at it, where a solitary figure is seated quietly on the boat. Wiping rain droplets from his face, he makes his way down a wooden walkway leading to the boat, where Sarah is sitting, sheltered beneath the boat's canopy. She rises slowly, her clothes drenched, and he stares at her without expression. Sarah, appearing disappointed, emerges from under the canopy, walking past him and climbing onto the harbor. As she begins to walk along the harbor's length towards the walkway, she pauses momentarily to brush rainwater from her head. Rambo steps onto the harbor as well, and she turns her gaze towards him before retracing her steps back to him with an imploring look, brushing rain from her hair again. Rambo continues to stare at her, his face revealing no trace of emotion. She turns away from him and, with a faint smile playing on her lips, continues her walk along the harbor, clad in a soaked gray hoodie and jeans, and makes her way up the wooden walkway. Rambo rubs his chin thoughtfully, runs a hand through his hair again, and follows her along the harbor.

As the morning light filters onto Rambo's boat, which is now motoring steadily along the river, Michael gathers his party and addresses them, while Rambo is occupied at the tiller. Michael casts a brief glance at Rambo, who acknowledges him only with the slightest flicker, leaning stoically on the tiller with determination. Sarah approaches Rambo, offering him a soft smile, before turning away once more. Later, at dusk, the boat maneuvers around a headland, and a small, white glimmer emerges on the river. The boat's headlamps mounted on its canopy cast a cone-shaped reflection in the water. Michael and his group of volunteers doze softly in the boat, with Sarah nestled comfortingly against Michael's chest, while Rambo's attention is roused, taking in the scene around him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The villagers, lined up in a row, stand tensely with their hands placed firmly behind their heads. This posture of submission is abruptly adopted as they suddenly encounter a group of heavily armed men, who appear without warning. The soldiers, displaying no sense of compassion or hesitation, heartlessly open fire on these innocent and defenseless villagers. The terrifying sounds of gunshots result in the women letting out loud screams of terror, desperately covering their eyes in an instinctive act of fear. The soldiers, showing no mercy, forcefully invade the homes scattered throughout the village, dragging the young men outside into the open, all while the officer in charge stands by, observing with a detached and chilling demeanor. Amidst the chaos, one of the soldiers, with a cold lack of emotion, shoots a man, bringing his life to an abrupt end. The commander then steps forward and addresses the entire village, delivering a proclamation that leaves the women stifling their cries of anguish by covering their trembling mouths with their hands in terror.

Meanwhile, in the fortified area where Rambo is diligently working, sparks dance vividly in the dimly lit surroundings as he meticulously grinds round blades on a rapidly spinning wheel. The veins on his well-defined and muscular arms stand out prominently from the effort. After some time spent focusing on his task, he finally ceases his grinding work, letting the blade drop from his hands, and absentmindedly runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, resting precariously on a bench, is an old, rusted metal fan, balanced unstably on a rod. With a determined glance and a steady hand, he removes a nut from the rod, discards the aged fan without hesitation, and skillfully replaces it with his newly crafted creation, a modern fan. He carefully threads a new nut onto the rod's end and reaches over to the bench to grab a spanner. With deft precision, he tightens the nut securely and then expertly lifts the entire assembly off the bench, placing it down with care. Satisfied with his handiwork, he exits the workshop and steps out into the cool, rainy night air, taking a deep breath.

Below, by the water's edge, moored securely at the dock, his boat is waiting. Rambo gazes down at it, where a solitary figure is seated quietly. Wiping the raindrops from his face, he makes his way down the wooden walkway leading to the boat, where Sarah sits, sheltered beneath the boat's canopy. As the rain continues to fall gently, she rises slowly, her clothes drenched with rainwater, and he stares at her with an expressionless face. Sarah, appearing disappointed by his lack of response, emerges from under the canopy, walking past him without a word, and climbs onto the harbor. As she begins her walk along the harbor's length towards the walkway, she pauses momentarily to brush the rainwater from her head. Rambo steps onto the harbor as well, and she turns her gaze towards him before retracing her steps back to him, looking at him with an imploring expression and brushing the rain from her hair once again. Rambo continues to stare at her, his face revealing no trace of emotion or intent. She turns away from him and, with a faint smile playing on her lips, continues her walk along the harbor, clad in a soaked gray hoodie and jeans, and makes her way up the wooden walkway. Rambo pauses, rubbing his chin thoughtfully, runs a hand through his hair again, and then follows her with purpose along the harbor.

As the soft morning light begins to filter across the horizon and onto Rambo's boat, which is now motoring steadily along the river's surface, Michael gathers his party around him and addresses them with calm authority. Meanwhile, Rambo is occupied at the tiller, maintaining the boat's course with unwavering focus. Michael casts a brief glance in Rambo's direction, acknowledging his presence, to which Rambo responds with only the slightest flicker of recognition, leaning stoically on the tiller with determination and resolve. Sarah approaches Rambo at one point, offering him a warm, soft smile, before turning away once more to join the others. Later, as the day turns to dusk, the boat maneuvers carefully around a headland, and a small, white glimmer emerges on the river's surface ahead of them. The headlamps mounted on the boat's canopy cast a cone-shaped reflection in the water below, illuminating their path. Michael and his group of volunteers doze softly in the boat's cabin, with Sarah nestled comfortably against Michael's chest. Meanwhile, Rambo's attention is roused, keenly taking in the scene and surroundings around him as they continue their journey.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The villagers, with a palpable sense of trepidation, clasp their hands tightly behind their heads, as the stark realization dawns upon them that armed men have flooded into their peaceful haven. The scene swiftly escalates as soldiers mercilessly open fire, the sudden eruption of violence prompting women to cry out in despair and shield their eyes to escape the harrowing sight. Meanwhile, soldiers forcefully infiltrate homes, their aggressive actions culminating in the dragging out of unwilling youths from their sanctuaries, all under the unyielding, cool gaze of the officer who surveys the chaos with detached indifference. In a chilling moment, a soldier's weapon rings out, ending a man's life abruptly, an act that serves as a prelude to the commander's address to the villagers, words that leave the terrified women clutching their mouths in horror. Amidst this backdrop of turmoil, Rambo is secluded within the confines of his fort, where the rhythmic sparks fly as he expertly grinds round blades against a spinning wheel, the tension in his muscular arms highlighting prominent veins. Concluding this meticulous task, he allows the blade to drop from his grip and runs a hand through his hair, a brief moment of reflection. His attention then turns to a nearby bench where an old, rusty metal fan on a rod lies neglected. Rambo methodically unscrews a nut from the rod, discards the obsolete fan, and replaces it with his own creation, a new and improved fan. With precision, he adds a nut to the threaded end of the rod, and reaches for a spanner on the bench, using it to tighten the nut securely. Satisfied with his handiwork, he smoothly lifts the assembly and sets it aside before departing the workshop, stepping out into the night air heavy with rain. As he looks down towards the water's edge, he sees his boat moored below, a lone figure visible under the canopy. Unbothered by the rain pattering against his skin, he walks purposefully down the wooden walkway to the boat, where Sarah is seated, drenched beneath the protective cover. As she stands up, her clothes soaked, Rambo fixes her with a blank stare. Sarah's face betrays disappointment as she steps out from under the canopy, brushing past him to climb onto the harbor. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway, halting momentarily to brush rainwater from her head. Rambo, having stepped onto the harbor, catches her attention as she turns to look at him, her gaze full of imploration as she makes her way back towards him, again brushing rain away. Rambo maintains his impassive stare, his expression unchanging as Sarah offers a faint smile, choosing to turn away and retrace her steps along the harbor, her sodden gray hoodie and jeans clinging to her form. She ascends the wooden walkway, while Rambo stands silently, eventually rubbing his chin, passing a hand through his hair, and making his way along the harbor. The scene shifts to morning, where aboard Rambo's boat navigating along the river, Michael addresses his group, words mingling with the soothing hum of the motor. As Michael's eyes fleetingly meet Rambo's, Rambo returns the briefest acknowledgment, stoically maintaining his position at the tiller with both hands. Sarah approaches Rambo with a gentle smile that elicits no visible response, as he continues to guide the vessel forward. As dusk descends, the boat rounds a headland, a faint white glimmer emerging on the river, accompanied by a cone-shaped reflection cast by the boat's headlamps mounted on its canopy. Within this dimming landscape, Michael and his volunteers slumber, Sarah nestled close to Michael's chest, as Rambo's unwavering attention remains, his senses attuned to the river's flow.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the village, armed men confront the villagers, who stand with their hands behind their heads as soldiers open fire, prompting women to cry and cover their eyes. Soldiers forcibly drag youths from their homes under the watchful eye of a calm officer. After a soldier shoots a man dead, the commander addresses the village, leaving women silently terrified. Meanwhile, in Rambo's fort, he skillfully assembles a fan by grinding blades, replacing the rusty fan with his creation, and securing it with a spanner. He sets the assembled fan aside and exits into the rainy night, where he sees his boat moored with a solitary figure onboard. Rambo heads down the walkway to find Sarah under the boat's canopy. As she stands, wet and disappointed, she walks past him to the harbor, brushing the rain from her head. Rambo follows her to the harbor, where she turns with an imploring look before turning away with a faint smile. She walks along the harbor wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans, while Rambo silently watches before continuing along the harbor. The next morning, Rambo navigates the boat along the river while Michael addresses his party. Michael glances at Rambo, who remains stoic at the tiller. Sarah approaches Rambo with a smile before turning away. By dusk, as the boat motors around a headland with its headlamps reflecting in the water, Michael and the volunteers doze off, with Sarah nestled against Michael, while Rambo remains alert.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The villagers, living in a remote and impoverished area frequently affected by conflict, have their hands behind their heads as they find themselves confronted by armed men, and the soldiers, part of a feared militia notorious for its brutality, open fire on them, causing women to cry and hide their eyes in terror. Soldiers break into homes that have stood for generations and drag out youths while the officer, known for his ruthless tactics, watches coolly. A soldier, having been trained in battlefields far from this village, shoots a man dead, and then the commander addresses the village, often using speeches to instill fear, leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. In Rambo's fort, a makeshift workshop on the outskirts of a jungle known for its dense canopy, sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel, his veins standing out on his muscular arms from years of survival and resistance. He stops grinding, drops the blade, and runs a hand through his hair, which is damp from the humid environment. Nearby, a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench, remnants of a bygone era of machinery. He removes a nut from the rod, discards the fan, and replaces it with his creation, a new fan designed for efficiency. He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod, reaches onto a bench, picks up a spanner, and tightens the nut. He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down, then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air, typical of the region's monsoon season. His boat is moored below at the water's edge of a swollen river, and he looks down at it, where a solitary figure sits on the boat. Rambo wipes rain away from his face, perpetually tense from years on the run, and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat, where Sarah, a humanitarian aid worker caught up in the chaos, is sitting under the boat's canopy. She stands, soaking wet, and he stares blankly at her, the weight of his troubled past evident in his eyes. Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him, climbing onto the harbor built during colonial times. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway, pauses, and brushes rain from her head. Rambo steps onto the harbor; she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look, brushing rain from her hair once more. Rambo stares at her, his face betraying no emotion, a facade carefully cultivated over years of suffering. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor, wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans, garments that offer minimal protection against the persistent rain, and climbs the wooden walkway. Rambo, haunted by memories of loss, rubs his chin, runs a hand through his hair, and walks along the harbor. In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river, which snakes through territories marked by historical conflict, Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the tiller. Michael glances at Rambo, who affords him the merest flicker in return, as Rambo stoically leans on the tiller with both hands, steering the boat with the precision of a skilled navigator. Sarah approaches him, smiles, and turns away, hoping to convey a sense of trust. At dusk, the boat motors around a headland, a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a cone-shaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat, which has headlamps mounted on its canopy to navigate the treacherous waters. Michael and his volunteers, exhausted by their mission, doze in the boat, with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest for warmth, while Rambo's attention is caught by the ever-present danger lurking in the shadows.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men and the soldiers open fire on them causing women to cry and hide their eyes. Soldiers break into homes and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly. A soldier shoots a man dead and then the commander addresses the village leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. In Rambo's fort sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He stops grinding drops the blade and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench. He removes a nut from the rod discards the fan and replaces it with his creation a new fan. He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod reaches onto a bench picks up a spanner and tightens the nut. He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air. His boat is moored below at the water's edge and he looks down at it where a solitary figure sits on the boat. Rambo wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy. She stands soaking wet and he stares blankly at her. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him climbing onto the harbor. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway pauses and brushes rain from her head. Rambo steps onto the harbor. she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look brushing rain from her hair once more. Rambo stares at her his face betraying no emotion. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans and climbs the wooden walkway. Rambo rubs his chin runs a hand through his hair and walks along the harbor. In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river. Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the tiller. Michael glances at Rambo who affords him the merest flicker in return as Rambo stoically leans on the tiller with both hands Sarah approaches him smiles and turns away. At dusk the boat motors around a headland a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a coneshaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat which has headlamps mounted on its canopy. Michael and his volunteers doze in the boat with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest while Rambo's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men and the soldiers open fire on them causing women to cry and hide their eyes. Soldiers break into homes and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly. A soldier shoots a man dead and then the commander addresses the village leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. In Rambo's fort sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He stops grinding drops the blade and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench. He removes a nut from the rod discards the fan and replaces it with his creation a new fan. He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod reaches onto a bench picks up a spanner and tightens the nut. He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air. His boat is moored below at the water's edge and he looks down at it where a solitary figure sits on the boat. Rambo wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy. She stands soaking wet and he stares blankly at her. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The kangaroos have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men, and the dolphins open fire on them, causing kittens to cry and hide their eyes. Pelicans break into homes and drag out youths while the penguin watches coolly. A rabbit shoots a man dead, and then the shark addresses the village, leaving terrified puppies to cover their mouths. In Gandalf's fort, sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel, his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He stops grinding, drops the blade, and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench. He removes a nut from the rod, discards the fan, and replaces it with his creation, a new fan. He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod, reaches onto a bench, picks up a spanner, and tightens the nut. He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down, then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air. His submarine is moored below at the water's edge, and he looks down at it, where a solitary figure sits on the submarine. Gandalf wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the submarine, where Hermione is sitting under the submarine's canopy. She stands, soaking wet, and he stares blankly at her. Hermione looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him, climbing onto the harbor. She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway, pauses, and brushes rain from her head. Gandalf steps onto the harbor; she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look, brushing rain from her hair once more. Gandalf stares at her, his face betraying no emotion. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor, wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans, and climbs the wooden walkway. Gandalf rubs his chin, runs a hand through his hair, and walks along the harbor. In the morning light on Gandalf's submarine as it motors along the river, Frodo addresses his party while Gandalf is at the tiller. Frodo glances at Gandalf, who affords him the merest flicker in return, as Gandalf stoically leans on the tiller with both hands. Hermione approaches him, smiles, and turns away. At dusk, the submarine motors around a headland, a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a cone-shaped reflection in the water thrown by the submarine, which has headlamps mounted on its canopy. Frodo and his wizards doze in the submarine, with Hermione nestled against Frodo's chest, while Gandalf's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men, and the guards open fire on them, causing women to cry and hide their eyes. Guards break into sheds and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly. A guard shoots a man dead, and then the commander addresses the hamlet, leaving terrified women to cover their mouths. In Rambo's workshop, sparks fly as he grinds circular gears on a turning lathe, his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He stops grinding, drops the gear, and runs a hand through his hair. Nearby, a rusty metal wrench on a post lies on a stool. He removes a bolt from the post, discards the wrench, and replaces it with his creation, a new wrench. He adds a bolt to the thread at the end of the post, reaches onto a stool, picks up a hammer, and tightens the bolt. He deftly lifts the assembly off the stool and puts it down, then leaves the shop and walks out into the foggy night air. His raft is anchored below at the river's edge, and he looks down at it, where a solitary figure sits on the raft. Rambo wipes fog away from his face and walks down a stone pathway to the raft, where Sarah is sitting under the raft's tarp. She stands, soaking wet, and he stares blankly at her. Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the tarp and walks past him, climbing onto the pier. She begins to walk the length of the pier towards the pathway, pauses, and brushes fog from her head. Rambo steps onto the pier; she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look, brushing fog from her hair once more. Rambo stares at her, his face betraying no emotion. She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the pier, wearing a sodden gray windbreaker and trousers, and climbs the stone pathway. Rambo rubs his chin, runs a hand through his hair, and walks along the pier. In the morning light on Rambo's raft as it drifts along the canal, Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the rudder. Michael glances at Rambo, who affords him the merest flicker in return, as Rambo stoically leans on the rudder with both hands. Sarah approaches him, smiles, and turns away. At dusk, the raft floats around a promontory, a small white glimmer appearing on the canal and a cone-shaped reflection in the water thrown by the raft, which has headlights mounted on its tarp. Michael and his volunteers doze in the raft, with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest, while Rambo's attention is caught.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The villagers keep their hands behind their heads as they encounter armed men, and the soldiers shout at them, causing women to laugh and cover their ears. Soldiers walk into homes and guide out youths while the officer observes nonchalantly. A soldier questions a man loudly, and then the commander praises the village, leaving delighted women to clap their hands. In Rambo's fort, embers dance as he polishes round blades on a spinning wheel, his veins standing out on his muscular arms. He pauses polishing, sets aside the blade, and pats a hand on his arm. Nearby, a rusty metal fan on a rod rests on a bench. He removes a screw from the rod, keeps the fan, and exchanges it with his creation, a new fan. He inserts a bolt to the thread at the end of the rod, reaches onto a bench, picks up a spanner, and loosens the bolt. He carefully places the assembly on the floor and picks it up, then enters the workshop and steps into the dry night air. His boat is anchored below at the water's edge, and he glances down at it, where a solitary figure reclines on the boat. Rambo brushes rain from his hair and strolls down a wooden walkway to the boat, where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy. She rises, soaking wet, and he gazes curiously at her. Sarah looks hopeful as she steps out from the canopy and walks past him, stepping onto the harbor. She begins to stroll the length of the harbor towards the walkway, pauses, and wipes sweat from her head. Rambo saunters onto the harbor; she turns and gazes at him before strolling back towards him with a questioning look, wiping sweat from her hair once more. Rambo gazes at her, his face revealing no concern. She turns away from him with a broad smile and saunters back along the harbor, wearing a damp gray hoodie and jeans, and climbs the wooden walkway. Rambo scratches his chin, pats a hand through his hair, and saunters along the harbor. In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it drifts along the river, Michael entertains his party while Rambo is at the tiller. Michael glances at Rambo, who gives him the faintest nod in return as Rambo casually lounges on the tiller with both hands. Sarah approaches him, waves, and steps away. At dusk, the boat drifts around a headland, a small white shimmer appearing on the river and a circular reflection in the water cast by the boat, which has headlamps mounted on its canopy. Michael and his volunteers rest in the boat, with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest, while Rambo's gaze is diverted.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The owls have their wings behind their beaks as they discover armored beetles, and the lizards unleash fire upon them, causing pebbles to laugh and hide their feathers. Lizards break into nests and drag out acorns while the cloud watches lazily. A lizard burns a leaf flat, and then the mushroom addresses the grove, leaving silent pebbles to cover their blossoms. In Eagle's nest, embers fly as it sharpens oval stones on a spinning wheel, its feathers standing out on its broad wings. It halts sharpening, drops the stone, and runs a talon through its feathers. Nearby, a creaky wooden fence on a branch lies on a rock. It removes a pebble from the branch, discards the fence, and replaces it with its creation, a new fence. It adds a pebble to the thread at the end of the branch, reaches onto a rock, picks up a twig, and tightens the pebble. It elegantly lifts the construction off the rock and puts it down, then leaves the nest and glides out into the stormy day air. Its leaf is perched below at the meadow's edge, and it looks down at it, where a solitary feather rests on the leaf. Eagle wipes dew away from its beak and glides down a wooden path to the leaf, where Lily is resting under the leaf's shade. She rises, drenched, and it gazes blankly at her. Lily looks dejected as she steps from the shade and glides past it, flying onto the reef. She begins to glide the length of the reef towards the path, pauses, and brushes dew from her wing. Eagle steps onto the reef; she turns and gazes at it before gliding back towards it with a pleading expression, brushing dew from her feathers again. Eagle gazes at her, its beak betraying no feeling. She turns away from it with a faint grin and glides back along the reef, wearing a soaked red scarf and leggings, and climbs the wooden path. Eagle rubs its beak, runs a talon through its feathers, and glides along the reef. In the morning glow on Eagle's leaf as it drifts along the stream, Fern addresses its group while Eagle is at the rudder. Fern glances at Eagle, who affords it the slightest nod in return, as Eagle stoically leans on the rudder with both talons. Lily approaches it, grins, and turns away. At twilight, the leaf drifts around a promontory, a tiny pink glow appearing on the stream and a triangle-shaped glint in the water cast by the leaf, which has lanterns mounted on its shade. Fern and its companions nap in the leaf, with Lily nestled against Fern's chest, while Eagle's interest is captured.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The cats have their paws on their cheeks as they discover unarmed dogs, and the chefs toss pies at them, causing children to laugh and cover their eyes. Chefs wander into barns and lift out kittens while the gardener observes calmly. A chef tosses a taco nearby, and then the conductor narrates to the barnyard, leaving joyful children to clap their hands. In Einstein's lab, fumes rise as he polishes square crystals on a rotating wheel, his brows furrowed in concentration. He stops polishing, places the crystal aside, and scratches his chin. Nearby, a broken ceramic vase on a shelf remains untouched. He unscrews a bolt from the shelf, ignores the vase, and replaces it with his invention, a new vase. He adds a bolt to the hinge at the edge of the shelf, reaches onto another shelf, grabs a wrench, and secures the bolt. He skillfully raises the structure off the shelf and places it down, then exits the lab and steps out into the misty morning air. His bike is leaning below against the garden fence, and he gazes down at it, where a timid cat rests on the seat. Einstein brushes droplets away from his glasses and descends a wooden ladder to the bike, where Lucy is crouching under the bike's frame. She rises, slightly chilled, and he glances indifferently at her. Lucy appears thoughtful as she steps out from the frame and moves past him, climbing onto the sidewalk. She starts to walk the path of the sidewalk towards the gate, pauses, and wipes dew from her face. Einstein steps onto the sidewalk; she turns and glances at him before moving back towards him with a hopeful expression, wiping dew from her hair again. Einstein gazes at her, his demeanor revealing nothing. She looks away from him with a fleeting grin and strolls back along the sidewalk, dressed in a damp blue sweater and skirt, and ascends the wooden ladder. Einstein scratches his nose, brushes fingers through his beard, and strides along the sidewalk. In the afternoon sunshine on Einstein's bike as it coasts along the trail, David narrates to his group while Einstein is at the handlebars. David peeks at Einstein, who grants him a brief nod in return, as Einstein calmly grips the handlebars with both hands. Lucy steps closer to him, nods, and turns her back. At twilight, the bike coasts around a bend, a faint golden shimmer emerging on the trail and a triangular shadow on the ground cast by the bike, which has lanterns attached to its frame. David and his assistants rest on the bike, with Lucy nestled against David's shoulder, while Einstein's curiosity is piqued.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The villagers have their arms behind their ears as they discover armored tanks, and the soldiers unleash fireworks near them, causing women to laugh and cover their noses. Soldiers sneak into barns and carry out sheep while the officer observes warmly. A soldier tosses a pebble at a goat, and then the commander performs for the village, leaving amused women to cover their ears. In Rambo's shed, bubbles float as he paints square canvases on a rotating stool, his veins highlighting his artistic limbs. He stops painting, sets down the canvas, and brushes a hand through his beard. Nearby, a dusty plastic plant on a shelf lies on a table. He screws off a bolt from the shelf, discards the plant, and replaces it with his design, a new sculpture. He adds a bolt to the groove at the end of the shelf, reaches onto a table, picks up a screwdriver, and secures the bolt. He skillfully lifts the sculpture off the table and sets it aside, then leaves the studio and steps out into the windy night air. His bicycle is parked below at the meadow's edge, and he glances down at it, where a solitary figure reclines on the bike. Rambo wipes wind from his face and strolls down a stone pathway to the bike, where Sarah is sitting under the bike's basket. She rises, lightly sunburned, and he gazes quietly at her. Sarah appears unimpressed as she steps out from the basket and walks past him, climbing onto the dock. She starts to stroll the length of the dock towards the pathway, pauses, and brushes wind from her shoulders. Rambo steps onto the dock; she turns and gazes at him before walking back towards him with a pleading look, brushing wind from her forehead once more. Rambo gazes at her, his face revealing no expression. She turns away from him with a faint smirk and walks back along the dock, wearing a damp green scarf and trousers, and ascends the stone pathway. Rambo rubs his forehead, runs a hand through his beard, and strolls along the dock. In the morning light on Rambo's bicycle as it cruises along the trail, Michael regales his group while Rambo is at the handlebars. Michael glances at Rambo, who offers him the slightest nod in return, as Rambo stoically leans on the handlebars with both elbows. Sarah approaches him, grins, and spins away. At twilight, the bicycle cruises around a bend, a small white sparkle appearing on the trail and a triangular shadow in the meadow thrown by the bike, which has flashlights mounted on its basket. Michael and his volunteers nap in the trailer, with Sarah nestled against Michael’s back, while Rambo's interest is piqued.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cheetahs have their paws above their ears as they discover sugar gliders, and the monkeys unleash fireworks on them, causing giraffes to giggle and cover their noses. Monkeys enter igloos and pull out elders while the librarian observes quietly. A monkey throws a pebble skyward, and then the chef entertains the rainforest, leaving startled giraffes to adjust their ties. In Turtle's den, bubbles float as he polishes square feathers on a wobbling stool, his whiskers sticking out on his slender legs. He stops polishing, releases the feather, and scratches an ear with his tail. Nearby, an ancient velvet glove on a cane sits on a hammock. He unscrews a pebble from the cane, tosses the glove, and swaps it with his invention, a new glove. He screws a pebble to the string at the tip of the cane, reaches into a hammock, grabs a screwdriver, and secures the pebble. He skillfully lifts the contraption from the hammock and sets it down, then exits the kitchen and strolls into the breezy day air. His balloon is anchored above at the sky's edge, and he peers up at it, where a lone penguin perches on the balloon. Turtle wipes sunshine off his nose and strolls up a stone staircase to the balloon, where Violet is perched under the balloon's umbrella. She leaps, perfectly dry, and he gazes curiously at her. Violet appears elated as she descends from the umbrella and skips past him, climbing onto the meadow. She begins to skip the width of the meadow towards the staircase, halts, and shakes sunshine from her boots. Turtle hops onto the meadow; she spins and gazes at him before skipping back towards him with a hopeful gaze, shaking sunshine from her scarf once more. Turtle examines her, his expression revealing great excitement. She turns towards him with a bright grin and skips back along the meadow, wearing a vibrant red cloak and sandals, and climbs the stone staircase. Turtle pats his nose, scratches his ear with his tail, and skips along the meadow. In the starlit glow on Turtle's balloon as it drifts along the sky, Jeremy entertains his symphony while Turtle is at the reins. Jeremy peeks at Turtle, who offers him the slightest nod in return, as Turtle silently reclines on the reins with both tails. Violet sidles up to him, grins, and spins away. At dawn, the balloon drifts around a mountain, a tiny green sparkle appearing in the sky and a leaf-shaped glow in the air cast by the balloon, which has lamps affixed to its umbrella. Jeremy and his musicians nap in the balloon, with Violet nestled against Jeremy's shoulder, while Turtle’s interest is drawn.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Armed men arrive at a village, causing panic as soldiers open fire and drag out youths, watched by an unfazed officer. Meanwhile, Rambo is in his fort working on a new fan. After completing it, he leaves and discovers Sarah sitting on his boat. She appears disappointed, and despite Rambo's unemotional stare, she walks away in the rain. The next morning, Rambo pilots the boat while Michael addresses the group, barely acknowledging Rambo. Sarah attempts to engage Rambo with a smile but turns away. At dusk, as the boat navigates the river, Michael and his group rest, and a focused Rambo steers the boat, illuminated by its headlamps.

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look brushing rain from her hair once more Nearby a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench Rambo rubs his chin runs a hand through his hair and walks along the harbor Michael and his volunteers doze in the boat with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest while Rambo's attention is caught She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway pauses and brushes rain from her head Rambo wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans and climbs the wooden walkway She stands soaking wet and he stares blankly at her Rambo steps onto the harbor Rambo stares at her his face betraying no emotion Soldiers break into homes and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him climbing onto the harbor Michael glances at Rambo who affords him the merest flicker in return as Rambo stoically leans on the tiller with both hands Sarah approaches him smiles and turns away He removes a nut from the rod discards the fan and replaces it with his creation a new fan His boat is moored below at the water's edge and he looks down at it where a solitary figure sits on the boat A soldier shoots a man dead and then the commander addresses the village leaving terrified women to cover their mouths At dusk the boat motors around a headland a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a coneshaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat which has headlamps mounted on its canopy He stops grinding drops the blade and runs a hand through his hair In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod reaches onto a bench picks up a spanner and tightens the nut He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men and the soldiers open fire on them causing women to cry and hide their eyes In Rambo's fort sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel his veins standing out on his muscular arms Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the tiller

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Sarah looks disappointed as she emerges from the canopy and walks past him climbing onto the harbor She begins to walk the length of the harbor towards the walkway pauses and brushes rain from her head Rambo steps onto the harbor she turns and stares at him before walking back towards him with an imploring look brushing rain from her hair once more Rambo stares at her his face betraying no emotion She turns away from him with a faint smile and walks back along the harbor wearing a sodden gray hoodie and jeans and climbs the wooden walkway Rambo rubs his chin runs a hand through his hair and walks along the harbor In the morning light on Rambo's boat as it motors along the river Michael addresses his party while Rambo is at the tiller Michael glances at Rambo who affords him the merest flicker in return as Rambo stoically leans on the tiller with both hands Sarah approaches him smiles and turns away At dusk the boat motors around a headland a small white glimmer appearing on the river and a coneshaped reflection in the water thrown by the boat which has headlamps mounted on its canopy Michael and his volunteers doze in the boat with Sarah nestled against Michael's chest while Rambo's attention is caught The villagers have their hands behind their heads as they find armed men and the soldiers open fire on them causing women to cry and hide their eyes Soldiers break into homes and drag out youths while the officer watches coolly A soldier shoots a man dead and then the commander addresses the village leaving terrified women to cover their mouths In Rambo's fort sparks fly as he grinds round blades on a spinning wheel his veins standing out on his muscular arms He stops grinding drops the blade and runs a hand through his hair Nearby a rusty metal fan on a rod lies on a bench He removes a nut from the rod discards the fan and replaces it with his creation a new fan He adds a nut to the thread at the end of the rod reaches onto a bench picks up a spanner and tightens the nut He deftly lifts the assembly off the bench and puts it down then leaves the workshop and walks out into the rainy night air His boat is moored below at the water's edge and he looks down at it where a solitary figure sits on the boat Rambo wipes rain away from his face and walks down a wooden walkway to the boat where Sarah is sitting under the boat's canopy She stands soaking wet and he stares blankly at her
